example.eg: The stage was raised one metre above the audience.
example.egtrans: 舞台被升高到观众席头上一米处。

example.eg: There are twenty separate stages in this process.
example.egtrans: 整个流程分为二十个独立的步骤。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 阶段, 时期, 步骤

example.eg: At the end of the third stage, he was leading the bike race.
example.egtrans: 他在自行车比赛的第三阶段领先。

example.eg: My husband has Stage 4 lung cancer.
The enemy had staged the crimes to make us look guilty.
example.egtrans: 敌人谋划了这些犯罪活动，好让我们显得有罪。

example.eg: The theatre troupe staged a comedy last autumn.
example.egtrans: 剧团去年秋季上演了一出喜剧。

example.eg: Her interest in the stage led her to study theatre at university.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 舞台生涯, 戏剧表演职业

example.eg: The old rockets had multiple stages that fell to earth after the fuel was used in each.
example.egtrans: 老式火箭有多个级，每一级待自身的燃料耗尽就会掉落至地表。

example.eg: It's important to keep the stage clean so nothing interferes with the slide.
example.egtrans: 保持镜台的清洁很重要，这样玻片才不会受外界干扰。

example.eg: The stage actor did not want to work in films.
The community stages a festival each spring.
The army is set to stage an invasion tomorrow.
example.egtrans: 军队定于明日进行侵略。

example.eg: At this stage of the translation, you need to edit carefully.
She found herself center stage when she was chosen to represent her school at the event.
The project is still in an early stage.
The patient's symptoms are consistent with early-stage Ebola.
When my friend was in the end stage of her cancer, they moved her to a hospice.
You're such a funny guy: you should go on stage.
example.egtrans: 你真是个有趣的人，你应该上台去表演。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 登台演出, 上台表演, 上场

example.eg: John went on stage when he was barely 12 years old.
After months of filling in forms, I am at the last stage of applying for British citizenship.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最后阶段, 最后步骤

example.eg: The actress waited off-stage until it was time for her to come on.
The offstage whispering could be heard by the audience.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 舞台旁的，舞台后的，幕后的

example.eg: The furious director screamed at the actors offstage.
Even the most experienced performers feel nervous before going on stage.
Zack's conniving set the stage for Virginia's downfall.

dsense.name: stage directions
dsense.guideword: (instructions in script of a play) (剧本中的解说)

example.eg: The band entered the club through the stage door.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 后台入口, 剧场后门

example.eg: She performed beautifully, despite her serious attack of stage fright.
The stage manager has to do many tasks during the production of a show.
A lot of actors adopt stage names that are shorter than their real names.
The author wrote several stage plays.

dsense.name: stage right, also US: right stage
stage whisper
dsense.guideword: (actor's loud whisper) (使观众能听得到的低语)

example.eg: The actor delivered the line in a stage whisper.
The laryngitis left me unable to speak any louder than a stage whisper.

dsense.name: take center stage (US), take centre stage (UK)

example.eg: London took centre stage in 2012 when it hosted the Olympic Games.
